snippet: Elizabeth Kolbert uses a rare rhino and crow and the stories of other endangered or already vanished species to illustrate the fallout of mankind’s transformation of the ecological landscape.
abstract: Michiko Kakutani reviews book The Sixth Extinction: An Unnatural History by Elizabeth Kolbert.
lead_paragraph: Elizabeth Kolbert uses a rare rhino and crow and the stories of other endangered or already vanished species to illustrate the fallout of mankind’s transformation of the ecological landscape.

headline.print_headline: Cataclysm Has Arrived: Man’s Inhumanity to Nature
headline.seo: ‘The Sixth Extinction,’ on Endangered and Departed Species
headline.main: Cataclysm Has Arrived: Man’s Inhumanity to Nature
